main event: Several lights were observed in the sky over Ilion, New York on July 8, 1966.
interesting points: The lights were first observed as a single light, then appeared to increase in size and separate into a double light in the rectangular shape of the spectrum.
The lights made very sharp turns to the left, right, and back again, with a turning radius less than the diameter of the object.
The lights increased in brilliance and reached high speeds, with no sound detected.
The lights were observed through binoculars and appeared to be a fairly large luminescent object.
The lights were observed at around 45 degrees elevation and were lost behind clouds or blinked out after several maneuvers.
sighted object: Several bright lights in the sky, described as a single light that increased in size and separated into a double light in a rectangular shape
